Start.Content: Welcome to the Weapon System Tutorial. This tutorial explains how to use and customize your weapons.

StateA.Content: StarMade has four main weapon types at this point. Antimatter Cannons, Missiles, Damage Pulse and Damage Beam. Each weapon is useful on its own but in most situations a specific weapon will be the most effective.

StateB.Content:
StarMade uses a combination system for this. You can link two main computers together to change how the weapon behaves.
Each weapon has a secondary effect, that will be applied to the weapon it is linked to.

StateC.Content: Secondary effects: Cannons: Makes the weapon reload faster (machine-gun). Missile: Splits up the weapon into smaller parts (shotgun). Pulse: Increases the weapon damage (High calibre). Beam: Makes the weapon range greater and and the projectile faster (sniper).

StateD.Content:
As mentioned before, you have to connect two weapon computers together to combine them.
Both weapon computers have to have weapon modules connected to them.

StateE.Content: The ratio of connected blocks on each of the connected systems determines how much of the secondary effect the main weapon will receive. The damage however will be determined by the total block count from all weapon blocks.

StateF.Content: Example, a weapon that uses 50 blocks in combination with another weapon that uses 50 blocks has the same damage per second as a single weapon with 100 blocks.

StateG.Content:
Try this now. Place down a weapon computer and connect 5 weapon modules to it.
Next, place another weapon computer down and connect 5 weapon modules to that.

StateH.Content:
Now press $SELECT_MODULE on the weapon computer you want to use as your main weapon.
Finally press $CONNECT_MODULE on the second weapon computer. The coloured boxes around the computers will now indicate its connection.

StateI.Content:
You can also do the same with the 'drag and drop' feature in the weapon menu (open with $WEAPON_PANEL). Just pick a weapon and drag it into the slave slot of another.
You can also unlink by selecting a slave and dropping it in the unlink box.

StateI1.Content: Your cannon will now fire 15 times faster but each shot will do less damage. The total DPS will be the same as one cannon computer with 10 cannon modules linked to it.

StateJ.Content:
If you connect 7 blocks to the main computer and 3 to the secondary, you will only get around half of the reload buff but each shot will do more damage.
The DPS remains unchanged. This way you can fully customize your weapon.

StateK.Content: Keep in mind that the weapon computer can only be used in ONE combination at a time, so choose wisely what you want.

StateL.Content:
You can also add effect blocks to a weapon computer, which will change the type of damage you are doing.
This will be covered in the 'Effects Tutorial'.

StateM.Content: Additionally you can link light sources to your weapon, to change the colour of that weapon's projectile.

End.Content: This concludes the Weapon System Tutorial. Thanks for reading, and thanks for playing StarMade!
